replies.body: If you say anything in chat and get reported by more than 2 people, you can get penalized. Even if you just said "gg". It happened a lot last season with Flex Queue.
not true all reports do is flag someone weather it be 1 report or 9 and then someone checks out what happened.

Actually more reports carry more weight.
And yes, I have seen people get chat banned for saying gg just because their entire team reported them. This was all back in S6 during the infamous flex queue but it did happen and I'm sure it still does.

> Actually more reports carry more weight.

There is no report weighting. Reports (whether 1 or 9) flag a game for review.

> And yes, I have seen people get chat banned for saying gg just because their entire team reported them. 

If you have a case of this happening, please share the link. I've been an engineer in Player Behavior for over 5 years and have never seen a case like this. It's theoretically impossible.

I've been chat banned and had my account suspended and have said almost nothing in chat.

League players are cancer and like cancer, they want to destroy any happiness of other players.

> I've been chat banned and had my account suspended and have said almost nothing in chat.

Post the logs here, or post from the account in question if you were suspended for saying almost nothing, so that I can see it. That's not how the system works.
Then what was the account that was banned so Tantram can look it up?
You're nothin' but a bluffer. Stick that pea shooter back in its holster. This thread ain't big enough for the two of you. ;)

That is false. It has been stated by Rioters, Arbiters, etc. Reports simply flag a game for review, multiple reports in a single match do not add any more "weight" to the review, than a single report. It specifically done so that Premades can't abuse the system. 

Multiple and frequent games with legitimate complaints play a factor, but not the amount of reports in a single match.

Riot doesn't allow this now. The system prevents it.

Please stop spreading misinformation. You're making things worse.
I don't think that's the only reason for a report and you have to remember its all computer programs until it finally gets to a mod

Let's use your scenario and say you're a mod. Somebody gets reported by 1 person. You see this all the time. 99/100 the 2 just don't get along and flamed each other all game.

Then you see someone get reported by their entire team. You think to yourself, "Well, this person surely did something bad to piss off their entire team."
its all a computer program until it gets reviewed by someone
Then that person's a shit mod that can't do his job right.
Heh, when you read the chat logs of those that claim they were punished due to mass reporting, you'd find that their chat was indeed punishable.
no, really. they just said gg. Like I said, this was last season when it was 1v4 on the team so all 4 would gang up on that 1.
EDIT: moved to more relevant spot.

yea, I wouldn't trust that too much. There was a mass chat restriction / 14-day ban in TUR server and the chatlogs showed nothing.

Turns out there were super toxic in post game chat.

What you see here is just a small glispe of the story.

You chit-chat with people a lot. It's too easy to mistakenly say something too close to being harassment. Several things you said weren't blatant flaming but they were pretty damn close.

Try not talking about the past on your next account. Literally, if you focus on just discussing what is happening and what will happen it's nigh impossible to say something blaming because most blame is spoken in the past tense. This will also improve your gameplay because you will be typing less and playing more of the time.

you are right man .. so it seems i have some tiny thing to do before completely reforming. thats why im asking a big chat restriction like a month of no chat at all because i worked hard in this acc.. so creating a new one wont reform me i will be in the same level just starting all over again

Unfortunately Riot probably won't reverse the punishment in this case because you had moved up the tiers of punishment already. It takes really good behavior for quite some time to get out of the danger zone.

Your best bet is to submit a support ticket here:
http://support.riotgames.com/

And hope that they take pity on your case and like how much you have improved. It will also help to show them your plan for how you intend to continue improving your behavior.

You know what every one of these posts has in common.  The chat log is longer than everyone's chat combined in most games.   STOP CHATTING AND START PLAYING.  Maybe then you wont say something bad accidentally.
I think you should be aware that just because you don't say an "offensive word" like a racial slur, homophobic slur, sexist slur, etc... does not mean how you talk to people is not toxic.
When you're recently off a 14 day ban you are on very thin ice, and anything worthy of any sort of punishment will lead to a permanent ban unless you reform.
